intro: Pogonopus speciosus subsp. exsertus, commonly known as the showy pogonopus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It is also noted for its adaptability to arid environments.
